analysis.headline: Your Data Shared for Ads
analysis.quote: Please note that, as defined under certain U.S. state data privacy laws, “sharing” also relates to providing personal data to third parties for personalized advertising purposes. We may then share this information with third party advertising platforms and advertisers to facilitate the delivery and measurement of ads on such digital properties.

analysis.headline: Your Extensive Data Collected
analysis.quote: The data we collect can include the following: Name and contact data, Credentials, Demographic data, Payment data, Interactions (e.g., browse history), Voice data, Biometric data and identifiers, Content of your files and communications, Video or recordings (from physical locations), and Traffic data.

analysis.headline: Your Content Systematically Scanned
analysis.quote: some of our products, such as Outlook.com or OneDrive, systematically scan content in an automated manner to identify suspected spam, viruses, abusive actions... We use scanning technologies to create digital signatures (known as “hashes”) of certain images and video content on our systems.

analysis.headline: Your Biometric Data Collected
analysis.quote: Biometric data and identifiers. Data about you resulting from specific technical processing relating to your physical, physiological, or behavioral characteristics which allow or confirm unique identification.

analysis.headline: Your Content Disclosed to Government
analysis.quote: Finally, we will retain, access, transfer, disclose, and preserve personal data, including your content (such as the content of your emails in Outlook.com, or files in private folders on OneDrive), when we have a good faith belief that doing so is necessary to... Comply with applicable law or respond to valid legal process, including from law enforcement or other government agencies.

analysis.headline: Your Data Bought from Brokers
analysis.quote: Data brokers from which we purchase demographic data to supplement the data we collect.

analysis.headline: Your Data Trains AI Models
analysis.quote: As part of our efforts to improve and develop our products, we may use your data to develop and train our AI models.

analysis.headline: Your Cross-Context Tracking for Ads
analysis.quote: We use data we collect through our interactions with you, through some of our first-party products, services, apps, and web properties (Microsoft properties), and on third-party web properties, for advertising on our Microsoft properties and on third-party properties.

analysis.headline: Your Image Recorded in Stores
analysis.quote: If you enter Microsoft Store locations or other facilities, or attend a Microsoft event that is recorded, we may process your image and voice data.

analysis.headline: Your Voice Data Recorded
analysis.quote: Your voice data, sometimes referred to as “voice clips”, such as search queries, commands, or dictation you speak, which may include background sounds.
